meanings.definition: To make or become tougher or stronger.
meanings.sent1: She is toughening her muscles by lifting weights.
meanings.sent2: The leather is toughening with each application of conditioner.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that the soup was toughening up after simmering for hours.
meanings.sent4: His resolve was toughening like steel in the face of adversity.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays toughening the skin of the farmer working in the fields.

meanings.definition: The process of becoming tougher or stronger.
meanings.sent1: The toughening of the metal was evident in its increased durability.
meanings.sent2: His toughening from regular exercise was noticeable in his improved performance.
meanings.sent3: The toughening of the team's spirit was clear after their victory.
meanings.sent4: The toughening of the tree bark protected it from harsh weather.
meanings.sent5: The toughening of her resolve made her unstoppable in achieving her goals.
